metadata.synopsis: The same characters experience different realities across four separate stories in this experimental exploration of truth and identity. In one, Parisian salesman Mateo Strano (Marcello Mastroianni) abandons his wife, Maria (Marisa Paredes), then reemerges two decades later. In another, a professor becomes a panhandler. Next, a butler serves a young couple that has inherited a large house. And finally, a business mogul is confronted by a family he thought he had made up.

reviews: Three Lives and Only One Death may be a puzzle. But don't look too hard at the image at its center. You'll miss all the beautiful pieces.
There's enough stuff crammed into the four stories to write a Ph.D thesis.
Involving film about the fragmentation of self in a world of multiple role-playing.
Three Lives stars Marcello Mastroianni in one of the last and most enchanting of his screen appearances.
